articles.title: Anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's Demise Commemorated
Repeal of Decision on Troop Dispatch Demanded
Anti-National Act of South Korean Military Authorities Flayed
articles.content:
Repeal of Decision on Troop Dispatch Demanded 
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- More than 50 members of the Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea held a press conference in front of Kwanghwamun in Seoul on July 20 and demanded the government withdraw the decision on troop dispatch to Iraq, according to the south Korean MBC.
 If the government dispatches troops to Iraq it would be judged by the people, they said, asserting that the ruling and opposition parties should convene an extraordinary session of the National Assembly for reexamination of the decision on troop dispatch.    
 They declared that they would wage an infinite sit-in strike in tents at the Citizens Park of Kwanghwamun until the government cancels the decision on the troop dispatch.

articles.title: S. Korean Students' Hunger Strike to Check Troop Dispatch
Anniversary of Cuban People's July 26 Armed Uprising Observed
articles.content:
S. Korean Students' Hunger Strike to Check Troop Dispatch 
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The "hunger strike group for the withdrawal of the decision on troop dispatch to Iraq and renunciation of south Korea-U.S. cooperation for a war" of the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) called a press conference upon the formation of the group and went into a hunger sit-down for an indefinite period in Seoul on July 17.
 At the press conference head of the strike group Kim Song Jin, chairman of the Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration of the Jeonnam National University, and other speakers stated that the group would continue the hunger strike till the plan of the government authorities to send additional troops to Iraq is retracted. They said that during the strike they would wage a movement for the withdrawal of the decision on troop dispatch and declaration of national independence against the U.S. and one-person demonstration and conduct information activities.    
 Chairman of Hanchongryon Paek Jong Ho read a press release, which said the 12th-term Hanchongryon would launch into an all-out struggle to thwart additional troop dispatch to Iraq. He declared that it would go all out in the fight to check additional troop dispatch without fail and frustrate south Korea-U.S. cooperation for a war.

articles.title: Large-scale Blasting Carried Out with Success
8th National Exhibition of Invention and New Technology Opens
articles.content:
Large-scale Blasting Carried Out with Success 
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- A large-scale blasting was successfully carried out at the site of the Taean Friendship Glass Factory on July 22 to remove 300,000 cubic meters of earth. It is now under construction on the bank of the River Taedong in Taean County, South Phyongan Province, as a monumental edifice to be recorded in the history of the DPRK-China friendship.
 This was conducted on the basis of the thorough-going preparations made for the last blasting, drawing on the successes and experience gained in the earlier two blastings, one to blow up 400,000 cubic meters of earth and the other 300,000 cubic meters of earth.    
 The latest blasting has opened a good prospect of completing its site leveling earlier than scheduled.

Greetings to Cambodian Prime Minister
Humanitarian Goods Donated to DPRK
articles.content:
Greetings to Cambodian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Hun Sen upon his reappointment as Cambodian Prime Minister.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop favorably in the future, the message sincerely wished him a greater success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country and people's wellbeing.    
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Hor Nam Hong upon his reappointment as Cambodian minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation.

articles.title: Personal Letter and Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Humanitarian Goods Donated to DPRK
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The International Rotary donated humanitarian goods to the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
 A donation ceremony was held in Pyongyang on Wednesday. Present there were the members of its free cooperation delegation headed by Randal Eastman.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Thai Party Delegation
articles.content:
Personal Letter and Gift to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a personal letter and gift from Thaksin Shinawatra, leader of the Thai Rak Thai Party and prime minister of the Kingdom of Thailand.
 The personal letter and gift were handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on July 23 by Dr. Kantathi Suphamongkhon, a special envoy of the party leader and prime minister and a special representative of the party, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Negotiations for Transfer of U.S. Military Base in Ryongsan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Thai Party Delegation
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the Thai Rak Thai Party led by Dr. Kantathi Suphamongkhon, a special envoy of party leader and Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra and a special party delegate, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on July 23.
 Present there were Pak Kyong Son, vice-director of a department of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned.
